We will start with grades 7 and 12 and small schools. The other grades will follow in due course,” said the Minister Angie Motshekga.

description: On 1 June 2020, the Department of Basic Education in the Republic of South Africa laid out a plan of phased reopening of schools. From 1 June 2020, Grade 7, 12 and School of Skills: Year 4 will reopen. Learners in ECD (Grade R or lower in a school); Grade 1,2,3,6,10 and 11; School of Skills: Years 2 and 3;Schools for Learners with Severe Intellectual Disabilities ("SID"): Grades R, 1, 2, 3 and 6; and Special Care Centres for Learners with Severe and Profound Intellectual Disabilities ( "LSPID "): Years 1 -3 will reopen on 6 July 2020. Grade 4,5, 8 and 9; School of Skills: Year 1; and Schools for Learners with Severe Intellectual Disabilities( "SID "): Grades 4 and 5 will reopen on 3 August 2020 .
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 11th of January 2021, the Republic of South Africa announces a planned "the first part of the strategy is to acquire enough vaccine doses to reach herd immunity of around 40 million people in South Africa. The second part of the strategy is to identify the priority groups that need to be vaccinated as the country receive vaccine doses throughout the year. This will be done in phases. In Phase 1, with the first batch of vaccines, around 1.2 million front line health workers will be prioritized. In Phase 2, when more vaccines arrive, essential workers such as teachers, police, municipal workers and other frontline personnel will be prioritized. People in institutions like old age homes, shelters and prisons, people over 60 years of age and adults with co-morbidities will be prioritized. The total number planned to reach in this phase is around 16 million people. In Phase 3, with increased manufacturer supplies, the remaining adult population of approximately 22.5 million people vaccinated. The third part of the strategy is to distribute the vaccines throughout the country and to administer them to those who have been identified to receive them"
type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping; storage; administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On the 17 August 2020, The Republic of South Africa announced that  under Alert Level 2 from 18 August 2020 to 20 September 2020, a curfew will be enforced in which  "every person is confined to his or her place of residence from 22H00 until 04H00, except where a person is granted a permit to perform a services other than a services related activities listed under 'Specific economic exclusion' or to attend to a security or medical emergency".
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On 18 September 2020, The Republic of South Africa declared that under Alert Level 1,"every person is confined to his or her place of residence from 00H01 until 04H00 daily, except where a person has been granted a permission through directions by the relevant Cabinet, member, or is attending to a security or medical emergency; or has a permit to perform a service other than a service related to: night vigils; night clubs; the 35 land borders that remain closed; initiation practices; passenger ships for international leisure purposes; attendance of any sporting event by spectators; international sports events; exclusions relating to public transport services as set out in the directions issued by the Cabinet member responsible for transport and exclusions relating to education services as set out in the directions issued by
the Cabinet members responsible for education".
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On the 26 March 2020, the Republic of South Africa announces that, "licensed international airports designated as Ports of Entry operated by
licensed airport operator, cargo handling facility, airports repair facilities,
provider of airports maintenance or services, airport terminals, terminal
operations and in licensed airports operations, must provide adequate facilities for washing of hands and disinfection equipment for visitors, airport personnel and management for the duration of the regulations; the air service operator must provide disinfection facilities and procedures; biometric screening airports shall be suspended and replaced with a card system until further notice; and airport personnel shall be provided with appropriate safety gear and equipment
by their respective employers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On the 26 March 2020, the Republic of South Africa announced that " all owners of public transport facilities must on regular intervals provide
adequate sanitizers or other hygiene dispenser for washing of hands and disinfection equipment for users of public transport services for the duration of the direction. All operators must ensure that public transport vehicles are sanitized before picking up and after dropping off passengers; operators must ensure that all public transport vehicles door and window, handles, arm -rest and hand rails are sanitized before picking up and dropping off passengers; operators must ensure that all public transport vehicles are clean and tidy; all public transport operators must provide disinfection information materials and procedures; all drivers must wear a mask; any marshal who interacts with members of the public in public transport facility should wear a mask and the sanitizers used to sanitize all public transport vehicles must have a minimum of 60% alcohol content.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
Republic of South Africa prohibits Public Transport as of March 26 2020 at 23h59.

During the lockdown period all commuter transport service [...] is prohibited, except [...] for the purposes of rendering essencial services, obtaining essential goods, seeking medical attention, funeral services and to recieve [the] payment of grants: Provided that such vehicle carries no more than 50% of the licenced capacity and all directions in respect of hygenic conditions [...] are adhered to.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: Western Cape; Eastern Cape; Northern Cape; North West; Free State; KwaZulu-Natal; Gauteng; Limpopo; Mpumalanga
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
Republic of South Africa, policy effective from: March 26 2020 at 23h59 until April 16 2020 23h59.

SA is enforcing a 21-day mandatory quarantine for all South Africans, as well as any tourists and persons staying within the borders of the republic. "For the period of this Lockdown every person is confined to his or her place of residence (exceptions: for the purpose of performing an essencial service, obtaining an essential good or service, collecting a social grant, or seeking emergency, life-saving, or chronic medical attention)... and every gathering is prohibited (exception: funerals, max. 50 people in attendance)"
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: Western Cape, Eastern Cape, Northern Cape, North West, Free State, KwaZulu-Natal, Gauteng, Limpopo, Mpumalanga
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Republic of South Africa, policy effective from: March 26 2020 at 23h59 until April 16 2020 23h59.

SA is enforcing a 21-day mandatory lockdown for all South Africans, as well as any tourists and persons staying within the borders of the republic. "For the period of this Lockdown every person is confined to his or her place of residence (exceptions: for the purpose of performing an essencial service, obtaining an essential good or service, collecting a social grant, or seeking emergency, life-saving, or chronic medical attention)... and every gathering is prohibited (exception: funerals, max. 50 people in attendance)"
 UPDATE: On April 9, 2020 the nation wide lockdown - initially stated to end on April 16 - is extended by 2 weeks, now ending on April 31, 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa allows visits "to the extent and in the manner directed by the Cabinet member responsible" to: correctional centres, remand detention facilities, police holding cells, military detention facilities,  facilities controlled by the Department of Social Development, under Alert Level 4 from May 1 to May 31.

description: The Republic of South Africa allows visits "to the extent and in the manner directed by the Cabinet member responsible" to health establishment and facilities, with exception to when one is receiving treatment or medication in accordance with health protocols - under Alert Level 4, from May 1 to May 31.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In the Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 4, from May 1 to May 31, every person is confined to his/her place of residence, only able to leave to: 
A) Perform an essential service. 
B) Go to work, with an issued permit. 
C) Buy permitted goods.
D) Obtain services that are allowed to operate. 
E) Move children, as allowed. 
F) Walk, run or cycle in the permitted hours:  06H00 to 09H00.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description:
The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 3 from June 1 to August 17, enforces that those abiding in the Republic are only permitted to leave his/her place of residence to: 
A) Perform any allowed service. 
B) Travel to and from work. 
C) Buy goods or obtain services.
D) Move children. 
E) Exercise between allowed hours. 
F) Attend a place of worship. 
G) Attend a school or learning insitution, when opened.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Republic of South Africa announces the deployment of law enforcers made up of the South African Police Service (SAPS); the South African National Defence Force (SANDF), and metro police units […] to enforce the [lockdown] regulations" on March 23 2020.

UPDATE: The exact number was announced on April 02 2020

The Republic of South Africa announces the "Social Security Agency (SASSA) has also set aside over R400 million for social relief of distress through food parcels and vouchers to be rolled out on a larger scale" and "over 100,000 households across the country have been provided with food parcels, with further households being targeted through the Solidarity Fund and Department of Social Development’s Disaster Relief Fund" since the beginning of the lockdown on April 18 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 3, allows "professional non-contact sports matches, which may only include players, match officials, journalists and medical and television crew" from June 1. UPDATE: On July 31 2020, contact sports are also allowed to commence, ending this policy and initiating a new one.
type_sub_cat: Annually recurring event allowed to occur with certain conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 17 of August 2020, The Republic of South Africa announced that under Alert Level 2 "attendance of funeral is limited to 50 persons and will not be regarded as a prohibited gathering. During the funeral, night vigils are not permitted and a person must wear a face mask and adhere to all health protocols and social distancing measures" from 18 August to 20 September 2020.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 18 September 2020, The Republic of South Africa announced that under Alert Level 1 "attendance of funeral is limited to 100 persons or less. Provided that not more than 50 percent of the capacity of the venue is used, with persons observing a distance of least one and a half metres from each other. During the funeral, night vigils are not permitted and a person must wear a face mask and adhere to all health protocols and social distancing measures" from 21 September to 28 December 2020.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Republic of South Africa announced that under Alert Level 1, "gatherings at social events are limited to 250 persons or less in case of an indoor gathering and 500 persons or less in case of an outdoor gathering. Provided that no more than 50 percent of the capacity of the venue is used, with persons observing a distance of least one and a half metres from each other, wear a face mask and adhere to all health protocols" from 21 September to 15 December 2020 .
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Republic of South Africa's Office of the Provincial Commissioner of the Northern Cape states that taxis are being "checked whether they operate during the right time frames, everyone walking around was checked whether he or she complying with the President’s instruction of staying at home" on March 29 2020.

The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 4, declares a "person must wear a cloth face mask or a homemade item that covers the nose and mouth when in a public place, or another appropriate item to cover the nose and mouth" from May 1 to 31, 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 3, from June 1 2020 re-enforces that "a person must when in a public place, wear a cloth face mask or a homemade item that covers the nose and mouth, or another appropriate item to cover the nose and mouth". UPDATE: On July 12, 2020 an exception is made to this policy and it does not apply to "a person who undertakes vigorous exercise in a public place, provided that the person maintains a distance of at least three metres from any other person". This is in place until the end of Alert level 3, August 17.

description:
The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 2 Restrictions, reinforces that "a person, must when in a public place, wear a face mask" from August 18, 2020 without an end date announced.
